chunk-1b1543df794d06ac12399619acc81141.description: Africa is the continent where French is predominantly spoken, with a majority of French speakers and a surging youth population influencing the French language. It includes countries like Senegal, Ivory Coast, and the Democratic Republic of Congo, which are contributing to the evolution of French through slang and the incorporation of English words.

Marla, whose real name is Mariam Dosso, is a 19-year-old Ivorian rapper known for her unique style that mixes French, Ivorian slang, and English, thereby influencing the evolution of the French language.

Jean Patrick Niambé, also known as Dofy, is a 24-year-old Ivorian hip-hop artist who contributes to the evolution of the French language by creating words from his own realities, reflecting the influence of African experiences on the language.

Kinshasa, the capital of the Democratic Republic of Congo, has as many French speakers as Paris, highlighting the significant French-speaking population in Africa and its impact on the evolution of the French language.

Souleymane Bachir Diagne is a renowned Senegalese professor of philosophy and French at Columbia University, commenting on the evolution of French in Africa and the influence of creolized French in various media.

Zolan KannoYoungs, Catie Edmondson, Karoun Demirjian, and Michael D. Shear are the authors of the article discussing the changing French language in Africa, providing insights into the influence of African populations on the French language.
Columbia University is an educational institution where Souleymane Bachir Diagne is a professor and contributes to the discussion on the evolution of French in Africa.

chunk-050f218ffbe46e8cd0f8d6eb74153087.description: A political party in the United States aiming to gain control of the House from Republicans, including New York Democrats who are expected to use a recent ruling to shift control in Republican-held swing districts.

A political party in the United States currently holding control of the House, previously using district lines to win the majority, and now facing challenges from Democrats to shift control in swing districts.
A group that attacked Israel on October 7th and is involved in the conflict in Gaza, being condemned by Harvard's president Claudine Gay for 'terrorist atrocities'.
A region involved in a long-running dispute with Israel, with the Palestinian Authority governing parts of the West Bank and being involved in the conflict.
The governing body of Harvard University that expressed support for its leader and stance on the Hamas attack, with the university facing pressure to take a public position on the issue.

chunk-2f4798aaf45bae056a3be4ace74cf6df.description: The Denver Nuggets is a professional basketball team in the NBA, known for their participation in the highest-scoring game in NBA history on Dec. 13, 1983, along with the Detroit Pistons.
Vincent van Gogh was a renowned painter whose legacy is being celebrated at a Paris museum through an interactive exhibit featuring a lifelike doppelgänger of the artist.
